Material used.Description: Transgenic C. elegans expressing S129A, S129N, or S129G variants of SNCA were used to study axon degeneration and proteostasis.

Readout description.Result Description: S129A variants caused increased axon degeneration and impaired proteostasis in C. elegans.
S129N variants exhibited enhanced axon degeneration and reduced proteostasis compared to wild-type.
S129G variants showed significant axon degeneration and proteostasis defects in transgenic C. elegans.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each variant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each biological replicate was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type C. elegans expressing native SNCA were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transgenic C. elegans were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA and Student's t-test were used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No axon degeneration and normal proteostasis levels in wild-type worms.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Axon degeneration observed in ≥70% of worms and proteostasis levels reduced by ≥30% compared to wild-type.
